generated.title: Devastating Tornado Leaves Six Dead, Hundreds Injured in Brazil
generated.summary: A powerful tornado struck Rio Bonito do Iguaçu in southern Brazil on Friday, destroying approximately 80% of the city. Officials confirmed at least six fatalities and 437 injuries, prompting the State of Paraná to declare a state of calamity on Saturday. Local fire officials described the aftermath as resembling a war zone.
generated.author: Desk

seo.imageAlt: Buildings destroyed by tornado in southern Brazil
seo.metaTitle: Devastating Tornado Leaves Six Dead, 437 Injured in Brazil
seo.metaDescription: A powerful tornado struck Rio Bonito do Iguaçu in southern Brazil on Friday, destroying approximately 80% of the city. Officials confirmed at least six fatalities and 437 injuries; the state declared a calamity.

generated.body:
A destructive tornado tore through Rio Bonito do Iguaçu in southern Brazil's Paraná state Friday, causing widespread devastation to buildings and vehicles throughout the community.

The natural disaster has claimed at least six lives and left approximately 437 people injured, according to official reports. State authorities declared a calamity status on Saturday as assessment of the damage continues.

Emergency officials estimate that roughly 80% of the city lies in ruins following the violent weather event. Drone footage captured the extensive destruction across the municipality.

Jonas Emmanuel Benghi Pinto, Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Paraná Fire Department, told Brazilian media outlets that the scene in Rio Bonito do Iguaçu resembled a war-torn area, highlighting the severity of the destruction.
